My cellphone performs better.With only 1GB of system memory "RAM", and 2/3rds of that in use by the system software, this tablet tends to come up short more often. It works, mostly, but it desperately needs better software optimization and an Android system software update.I'm aware of CyanogenMod, which gives Acer an excuse to invalidate the warranty.Acer support has been completely useless. They ignore simple questions, just look at their own forums, twitter account...etc.

Reviews.Title: low quality touch screen
Reviews.Author: geva
Reviews.Content: pros:great display.great sound.cons:reacts slowly to touch screen. very slowly. practically i cannot play games on it, because of the slow response of the screen.slow cpu. theoretically it's a fast quad core, in practice, works slowly.

Reviews.Title: You guys don't Know what you are talking about!
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I don't see what those who wrote bad reviews were talking about.This is my first tablet and I did extensive research. My Acer arrived fast and in perfect condition and the android OS updated immediately.The most serious complaint is that the processor is weak.  That is a sad error on Acer's part but the only time I have had an issue is when I tried to put a motion background on it that I use on my phone.  It got so bogged down that it was basically unusable.  Too many pixels to move around!  That is the only time I have seen an issue.  I don't play any High end games though, I would use my desktop for that.  Videos play very well.The display is wonderful, HD videos look outstanding!Another thing that others seem to have trouble with is overheating.  That one gave me pause when I was reading the reviews.  But I haven't had that issue, maybe because it updated right away or maybe it is how I us it.  But although it gets warm, it doesn't get finger burning hot.Some have commented on it not being really thin and light.  I like the extra heft, I don't find it too heavy.  To me, it feels like I am carrying serious equipment and I don's want to feel like i might damage it if I hold it too firmly.  The main competition, ASUS A700, has had display issues. From trying to be too thin and light?When you consider the micro usb port and the fact that you don't have to pay extra for 32g of ram this is a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: david horne
Reviews.Content: Awesome tablet ! Display is crystal clear and plenty of storage space. Quick setup, connected to my wireless in 5 seconds, and surfing the web right away !! This is my 5th Acer product (3 laptops for the kids and tablets for wife and myself) so I highly recommend the acer products. Shipping was super fast which made it even nicer !!

Reviews.Title: Still performing well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet over a year now and is still performing extremely well. I am still experiencing  good performance and excellent support and updates from Google.  The tablet does get warm, but not uncomfortably so.  Installing a Roocase improves usability and comfort.  The HDMI port makes it easy to watch movies on  the TV.  32gb memory is a bargain,  as is the external expansion capability.  Battery life is a little low,  but not a problem. The screen resolution is fantastic, producing sharp, vibrant images.  The price has come down considerably, making it a better value yet.  I would not hesitate to buy another A700,  especially at the reduced price.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for a good price
Reviews.Author: Norberto W Zwirner
Reviews.Content: I just used it for a couple of days and need to get more familiar with it. At this time I can say that it is an excellent product that runs fast, easy to use and I would recommend it. It starts and shuts down fast. Screen resolution is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Decent high-end android tablet for little money
Reviews.Author: Vlad "Vlad"
Reviews.Content: I prefer Android over iPad because of its flexibility and future development due to the power of Google behind it. I was choosing between Acer A700, Asus TF700 and Samsung Note.Samsung is a good choice especially for handwriting, and overall iPad-like experience.Asus is also a good choice but to deliver the same long lasting battery usage like Acer has I would have to buy Asus keyboard that I did not want to do. To type a lot of text on a keyboard I have PC. With the price of Asus tablet and keyboard it becomes almost twice expensive Acer and equals decent middle stream laptop!So I am happy with my Android Acer. It works fast. I have a leather case on it so I do not feel when it gets warm (not hot) when you play Real racing game or have multiple apps working. I really do not care about warmth.I was able to install Adobe flash according to instruction on XDA.Having multiple browser tabs open, working with big size pdf files (like 100 Mb), working with dictionaries, watching videos, recording voice notes, playing audio files, all these multi-tasks are easy to perform for Acer A700.I would buy it again for this little price.

Reviews.Title: Very Cool
Reviews.Author: TANYA
Reviews.Content: This has a lot of neat programs. Easy to download apps. I got this as a gift for my husband. He loves it. Definetly recomend.

Reviews.Title: Nearly everything I wanted it to be.
Reviews.Author: D. Rinear
Reviews.Content: We have two I Pads in our home and my A700.  I have owned the A700 for six months now. I purchased this in June 2012 so it was waiting for me when we returned from our vacation.  I have several HD games and I have played with several different browsers/keyboards.  Default browser and keyboard work but you can find something better if you look.  The screen is beautiful and easy to read in all but direct sunlight.  The speakers accomplish their task very well and with good volume but of course recommend a good set of headphones.I have only found one thing that bugs me and that is intermittently in different apps the touch screen accuracy seems to drift to the right, I.E. if using the keyboard the key will only 'type' if I touch the lower right of the key.  This most often corrects itself if I exit the app and return.  I have noticed that the back panel on the right will get warm during a good gaming session, but not uncomfortably hot.  I chose the Poetic case and I am very pleased with the fit and finish.  I have recommend this tablet to my coworkers and one has bought the A210 cause it was a little cheaper.  The USB port has worked flawlessly and with out hick-up with upto 1GB ext drive sharing pictures and videos.  I have not tried the HDMI output so I can not comment.  Thank you Acer for such a great product.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: dhyslop
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet refurbished for 320 dollars, it came just like new, the screen is gorgeous it's really snappy, I haven't found any heat issues. The case it's not alumminum,  but it has a nice rubbery finish and feels nice, it my not be the slimmest and lightest tablet on the market but it feels really good to hold it. The battery life is amazing, more than 10 hours. The Jelly bean operating system works perfectly, I've had it for 4 days now and I haven't experienced a single force close or freeze, the truth is the graphic processor of this tablet is not as good as the other high resolution tablets as the asus tf700 or nexus 10 but you will only notice that when browsing heavy web sites and playing 3d games, but in my case I'm not a hardcore player, I mainly use it for handwritnig, reading and browsing the internet, so that is not an issue for me. Before I had an asus tf300 (wich I had to return because it would reboot every 10 or 15 minutes) and I can tell that the build quality of the a700 is much better.Update,I've been using this tablet for almost a year now,  and I love it,  I'm using it with cyamogen 10.2 and it feels smooth as silk. It migth not have support from acer,  but it does have official upgeades from cyanogen and pac man.

Reviews.Title: Fab tab!
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Bought refurbished in like new condition.  This is hands down the best tablet I have ever used or looked at, even.  The screen is bright and easy to see even in sunlight.  The picture is sharp and detailed.  Video (Netflix and Hulu) is stunning!  Got the Jellybean update immediately.  There is no lag, no hesitation, no problems.  Just performance.The front camera is great for streaming video on Skype or Google Voice.  I have not checked out the rear camera, though.The back has gotten a little warm, especially on the lower right side, but it is not objectionable.  I purchased a case for it and now, I don't feel a thing!I intend to root it and install the iconiaN 2.6 custom ROM to get flash and other things not included on the stock ROM.So, my only gripe is no Adobe Flash capability, but I can solve that.  I am very satisfied, and I recommend this tab to anyone.UPDATE:I have had the tablet for 3 months now.  I decided against installing a custom ROM.  The tablet handles everything well without being rooted or customized, so I have left it alone.  I installed GO Launcher, which takes care of all the customization I need.  The battery is excellent and charges fast.  I can see the screen in full daylight when it is at it's highest setting.  Most of the time I use the mid setting for everyday tasks.  It is a bit heavy, compared to say an iPad or such, but I couldn't touch an iPad for what I paid for this baby.I hate the music player, so I installed Winamp.  Now we're all good.  I plug in my 32G Mini SD and I have access to about half my music collection.  Plan to get another for the other half.  There is nothing quite so satisfying as having a song in your head, and 30 seconds later, hearing it on your music player!I don't do gaming, and rarely surf the web on it, so I can't speak to the 3D people, and I don't miss the Flash.  I use it to get the news, take notes in staff meetings, get my email, do a limited amount of texting, and watching the occasional video on Netflix, Hulu or YouTube. It is my default music player in my truck.  All without a single glitch.  For a guy like me, the price, the value and performance have far exceeded all expectation.The folx at XDA Developers tell me that it is soon to upgrade to Key Lime Pie (Android 5.0) but I don't really care.  It probably won't impact my use of the tablet that much.WTG, Acer.  I am most happy.

Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect... but OK now.
Reviews.Author: HDT
Reviews.Content: Everything writtent about this tablet is true. So i don't add anything else.I bought 3 tablets and 2 of them have the same problem: i don't know how nor when nor why, the tablet does not wake up when i push the on/off button. That does not happen at a regular frequency. Is it a hardware or software problem ?This is the solution to wake it up:1) push the on/off button for 20 seconds. That action actually shutdown the tablet.2) then push the on/off button for 5 seconds to reboot the tablet.Acer support does not even know this procedure.In general, the tablet is well built. I wish the same tablet with a more powerfull cpu. TF700 is not perfect either!!! so accept it when you pay 350, not at regular price.---Update : 2013-02-11Very happy NOT to send my tablet to Acer to be fixed because it's a SOFTWARE problem.I always use stock browser, and i checked "desktop" option. Somehow, that option prevents my tablet from waking up.Since i uncheck this option, my tablet wakes up all the time when i push the on/off button.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: A little jerky until Android "Jelly Bean" installed.No heat problems as other reviews have indicated.Even works with powered 4 port usb hub and can interact with multiple USB drives.

Reviews.Title: It was like they described
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: It was like they described in previous reviews. It is working like I was expecting for it and I have a great value (low cost and high quality)for it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet!
Reviews.Author: Divaphoenix "divaphoenix"
Reviews.Content: I just got this tablet about a month ago and I love it. It is light weight, seems  to be very well built and over all is really nice and feels pretty good.I wanted something light, portable with a good battery life, easy to carry and something that gives me the access to the internet, check my facebook, check my e mails, get good photos and video and be able to get on my skype while I am away from home. I am not a computer literate, so for me this tablet has all I need.I love it and I would recommend it to every one.It gets a little bit hot but it is not disturbing to me.Update:  After a several months I have only one complaint about this tablet. You cannot watch videos on facebook. To be able to do it Facebook asks you to update your Flash player but there is not update available for this tablet. So, That is kind disappointing for me (I am all day long on facebook). Acer and adobe must find a solution for this issue. Other than that I am very pleased with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Good machine
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: The picture is great.  I like the size-- better than the smaller screens.  Touch screen is appropriately sensitive and adjustable.  Comes with too many games pre-loaded- maybe that's good for some folks.  I like the machine.

Reviews.Title: Fire for Fireman, hot tablet it might even be overheating
Reviews.Author: R. Parker
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get my A700 because I love Acer laptops. Acer tablets have let me down with my experience with the  a700.ProsNice UITegra 3 quadAndroid 4.01080pConsHeat,OverheatingCouple of random shutdowns/restartNo 1080p apps

Reviews.Title: I really wanted a tablet but this one is just too hot
Reviews.Author: Gary P. Tanski "shadoe"
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet.  I was really excited to get it.  My excitement went away when trying to listen to music, surf the web, and just play when it just got too hot to hold.  It took about an hour before I just gave up.  I went from palming it to finger tip holding to turning if off to allow a cool down.  Even on the front, you could feel something wrong just swiping. The hot spot in the far right side middle in landscape orientation. I really like the features though.  The display is awesome.  If not for the high heat, this would have been a great tablet. I bought this to replace an aging laptop that becomes a furnace after a while of use.  I don't need two heaters.  I gotta believe that with a case on it preventing heat dissipation, this guy would eventually self destruct.  First time in years of using Amazon that I sent something back.

Reviews.Title: I have had my Acer for less than a day and already there are a myriad of problems
Reviews.Author: Cruxley
Reviews.Content: I was encouraged by my husband to try the Acer Iconia because it is a bit cheaper than the Nexus 10. After less than twenty-four hours with the product, I am ready to return it. Here's why:1. The tablet gets super hot while doing basic functions. I could understand if I were watching hours of video or something more taxing, but instead it delights in scorching my hands after a mere five minutes of checking emails.2. It has restarted itself four times. It generally likes to do this at the most inopportune moment; I am trying hard not to take it personally.3. When browsing the web, pages will load, but then there are these accursed white blocks running rampant inexplicably across the screen.4. There is a bizarre lag when reading ebooks. Call me a spoiled hedonist, but I do mind waiting ten seconds for the page to turn.5. On the loudest setting, the speakers are not able to overcome a simple fan. Very tragic, no?6. The permanent bloatware on this thing is unbelievable. Additionally, it includes Wild Tangent, which my old computer used to recognize as spyware in the 90s. What it is doing in this day and age, I do not know. I will give Acer the benefit of the doubt and pray that it is something else/I'm terribly mistaken.If you don't mind blowing your money on a sub par product that is clearly not built to last, by all means, go for it. Personally, I recommend checking out the Nexus 10, or even one of Samsung's Galaxy Note tablets. Both are equipped with better hardware and are in a similar price bracket, depending on the amount of memory you choose. Keep in mind that with things like Netflix, Drop Box and Google Cloud Drive, you could probably go for the 16 GB versions and be fine.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Giles "Giles"
Reviews.Content: Superb value for money - awesome features for a truly bargain price. Easy to set-up and easy to operate - superb display. Haven't been able to get it to play mkv files as yet but that is probably my fault more than the tablet!

Reviews.Title: Good but Slow
Reviews.Author: Richb "Richard"
Reviews.Content: Bought this product for the full-hd screen and I must say the screen is impressive however the responsiveness of the tablet as a whole is poor. I did manage to get the tablet to run a bit more smoothly by removing the Acer ring and installing a third party launcher but in the end returned it and got the ASUS TF700 which has the newer Tegra processor which seems to handle the increased number of pixels better. Not perfectly but better.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my new tablet so much! I bought a smaller, less expensive one about 6 weeks ago and found that I was having a hard time with it locking up and not running properly. This one is EXACTLY what I needed! I am not a tech savvy person, I just wanted a table I could read my kindle books on, keep up with social media, and watch Netflix on. This allows that and so much more! the quality of photos it takes is 20 times better than my previous table! I love having both a front and rear camera to take pictures and Skype without hassles for either. I would recommend this tablet for anyone who is a basic tablet user. I've hit middle age, and my eyes are betraying that fact, so reading small print or watching shows on a tiny little phone screen is more frustrating than fun for me. The size of this table is perfect! It offers a lightweight, portable option to take along with me. Many places offer free wifi now, so I can connect and enjoy Netflix or check social networking almost anywhere! Even when I don't have wifi available, I can read my kindle books or play any number of games while waiting for a doctor's appointment, or on my lunch break.

Reviews.Title: Acer Iconiatab A700
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: Bought this for Hubby for his birthday. He had bought me one locally. This one came with so many more bells and whistles, its amazing! He is never without it.. I mean never. If you are looking for a tablet that uses Linux, this is the one to buy, and this is the place to buy it! It is almost impossible to find a tablet without Windows 8. This is a superb value, and a great piece of equipment!

Reviews.Title: Negatives to Report on the A-700 After 8 month use.
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Aldridge
Reviews.Content: I've had this A-700 tablet since July 2013. Overall, it pretty good and probably worth the price. The kids love it.There are some Negatives to report:1. The screen image is KILLED almost completely in sunlight. If you planned to use this tablet outdoors or in a car in sunlight, forget it.2. NO Type A (standard and largest) USB port. This tablet uses only a micro-USB port for data transfer and charging. Small and seems more delicate. Requires ADAPTER for any Standard Type A USB use.3. Charger failed and a new one is a non-standard charger and should be obtained from Acer. Replacement cost for a plug-in charger is relatively high. ~$30.4. The A-210 may have been a better choice in this price range. The advertised higher-resolution A-700 screen is not much better visibly than the A-200/210.

Reviews.Title: A good tablet to get.
Reviews.Author: BetaRayBill
Reviews.Content: This tablet was fine. It didn't end up suiting our needs, but it was well made. Will consider the Acer brand in the future.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Ri Ki
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a very decent device.  I got it as a gift for my mom, and she absoluetly loved it.

Reviews.Title: Decent size storage and handles movies well
Reviews.Author: Miron B.
Reviews.Content: Got this for my dad(50) mainly for movies and he loves it.  Decent amount of storage and excellent quality screen.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, a bit heavy.
Reviews.Author: Sin@ "Sina"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased hundreds of computers and tablets for the company I work for in the past 5 years and this tablet has been one of the best considering the features and the price. The quad core cpu works faster than my own more expensive ASUS transformer tablet. The only disadvantage is the weight which is a bit more heavier than what you might have in mind by another tablet you have had experienced with. It easily deserves 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Juan Giraldez
Reviews.Content: the product met all my expectations and works properly.locate this product on amazon and the recommendations were spot on.I highly recommend it.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Acer ICONIA Tab A700-10s32u 10.1-Inch Tablet
Reviews.Author: Thomas Nocton "NocListr"
Reviews.Content: Wife has had this for over a year and it is still thoroughly used.  She is always commenting about how it will do so many different things.  It has to be charged more regular now because the batteries on tablets just don't hold up well to the heavy usage.  I will replace the battery when it gets to be a pain for her so I pull one star for that but functionally it is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great for watching Netflix
Reviews.Author: Darius Wiles
Reviews.Content: A great tablet that I regularly use for watching Netflix. I used it for an extended period outside on a hot day and it overheated. The screen cut out for a split second a few times, then the tablet locked up, so I switched it off and let it cool off. I had it in a leather case, which probably didn't help, and when I removed the tablet to let it cool off, one part of the back was very hot. I haven't experienced a problem since, but I would expect similar problems could occur by stressing the tablet for an extended period, e.g. by playing CPU intensive games in a hot environment.Apart from the potential for overheating, it's a great tablet with long battery life that is stable, has good wifi connectivity and a good screen resolution. The in-built speakers are good and the touchscreen is responsive.

Reviews.Title: Very snazzy tablet
Reviews.Author: Jim Erbe
Reviews.Content: An excellent tablet for the wife. She plays Candy Crush and other games on it. Very fast. It was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: meh
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Item worked so thats a plus. But it was freezing alot so I had to spend like 5+hrs working on it and I hope I got it to stop freezing. Plus shortly after I got the tab the charger went out so I had to buy a new charger for it which ran me an extra 30ish dollar's.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet except for the heat problem
Reviews.Author: Kenneth J. Klechak
Reviews.Content: The tablet performed perfectly except for the heat buildup,  I would have liked to have kept the table except for the concern of the heat problem.

Reviews.Title: it is ok but not as good as the a510
Reviews.Author: Tony B. Zawk "Tony B. Zawk"
Reviews.Content: Not what i expected to be. Sold my a510 to buy this and apart from the higher resolution screen it underperforms its sibling in every aspect

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Had a small scratch on glass that was not in description, it is a demo.I would recommend this tablet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good for certain uses
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Silver
Reviews.Content: I have a Nexus 4 phone and it's buttery smooth.  This tablet isn't.  The OS is slow and sluggish at times and is outdated.  Acer has hinted they will upgrade the operating system, but it's taking a LONG time to actually happen.  Ordinarily, I wouldn't care about an OS upgrade, however, profiles (which are available in a later version of the OS) are an excellent feature for those with a family all using the same tablet.The tablet does have good battery life and does play videos smoothly as well as most games I've played.I love using it for reading books.The tablet does use a proprietary charger.  It probably uses a high amperage.  This means you won't be able to charge it (slowly) via USB in a pinch.It does get a bit warm on one side, but not enough to be a problem.I can't give it 5 stars since the OS is sluggish and is not updated very often, but overall, we get much use out of it.  I would buy a refurb as you can save a decent amount of money.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: tom
Reviews.Content: Fast enough but smaller than I had envisioned. Not light for its size. Upside is that it is fast. Internet pages load quick and navigation is a breeze

Reviews.Title: OK Tablet, Bad Software!
Reviews.Author: Red Sun
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet with 4.1.1 Jelly Bean, the last official over-the-air OTA stock ROM. But this thing froze and restarted itself all the time and it is entirely bad.I tried to flash with the CM 10.1.1 ROM, IconiaN ROM. Both of them behaved the same way.So I tried with the original stock ROM, AV043 RV07RC06 PA CUS1 ROM. Amazingly it works! No freezes and no more random restarts.What I can say is that, A700 hardware is ok, but the Android software implementation is totally bad. Acer is doing something that failed Blackberry the same way, bad software.Now I can play Netflix with no problem. Have not tried gaming yet since I'm not a gamer. But the other ROMs are totally unacceptable.So my advice is that, stay with the original factory ROM if you can. Do not update OTA. If your tab has any random freeze, learn how to flash the ROM to original. There is tons of info on the web. The hard part is to get the USB driver to enable bootloader. Also, follow the instruction exactly.Update 10/9/2013:Tab still works fine. But it would go into hibernation when not used for long time. Do not how to fix it yet. At least it works.

Reviews.Title: Acer has done it again
Reviews.Author: Anson B. Isaac
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a great investment. It has a solid body, with solid hardware and technology packed inside this beast. I would recommend this item to anyne.

Reviews.Title: Acer Iconia
Reviews.Author: SuziDuzi
Reviews.Content: I love it.  I can take it with me instead of my larger laptop. It isbetter than others I looked at and at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: Acer Iconia Tab has me hooked!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty new to the world of tablets. The Iconia is the second one I've purchased, and it has made a confirmed tablet user. While it can't replace my PC for many things, the ability to just sit in my easy chair with this light 10-inch screen has given me options Ididn't have before.

Reviews.Title: Battery overheats
Reviews.Author: lulego
Reviews.Content: I bought the Acer Iconia A700 tablet from Amazon last August 24, 2013. From the begining, the battery overheats as much as I think it is going to exploit!! Additionally, it is too heavy.

Reviews.Title: valuable tablet
Reviews.Author: miaof
Reviews.Content: If you only need tablet for internet and some small games, it is wonderful one. The only weakness is it is overheat when you are playing games. But I think it is normal condition. I love this tablet!

Reviews.Title: a fine choice
Reviews.Author: brian whitehead
Reviews.Content: it simply does, what acer is knowed for it works. I also own an acer 200,thats also good and working

Reviews.Title: I really like Acer
Reviews.Author: A. Myers
Reviews.Content: I have always like Acer computers and now I enjoy the Acer tablet. The large screen and easy to operate physical buttons are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: drexel75
Reviews.Content: This is my first tab so i have nothing to compare it to but so far its great. Fast and very well made. Acer is coming up in the world and I look to acer first now for my device purchases.

Reviews.Title: delivery
Reviews.Author: D. Mason
Reviews.Content: I love this for the short time it worked which was under a week.When delivered it was dropped over a 6 foot fence by Amazons delivery service and was broken. It stopped working completely in under a wek. So it was replaced by another and low and behold can you believe after a along discussion it was delivered by the same srevice and same driver and het did the exact same thing... With that I refused the item and explained to Amazon how this was unacceptable..Cannot believe they would not used FEDEX or UPS instead they used California Overinght.They sent it from a large warehouse in N. Las Vegas, NV and I live is Spring Valley,  NV which is less than 20 miles away and still they use the cheapest service...The item was great, the serice sucked!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Tablet
Reviews.Author: J. B. KAMUI "jlblancom"
Reviews.Content: Really like this tablet. Nice resolution, audio, good performance and good capacity. Full Recommended Go For It Best Choice Not expensive

Reviews.Title: very happy with my new tablet
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: my new tablet works great everyone needs one of theese. Now my wife wants one I really enjoy the GPS

Reviews.Title: E Book Help
Reviews.Author: C. Harkness
Reviews.Content: I just received my Acer Iconia Tab A700. First Acer product for me. I really like this tablet,it is very responsive,has an exreme quality for screen resolution.It is very easy to manage content except for EBooks. I have an extensive library of EBooks in multiple formats.The only negative I have at the moment is I cannot load any EBooks. I have tried EPUB, and i get the message, DEVICE DOES RECOGNIZE FORMAT. I have called Customer Support 3 times, each time i have been told something different to do to the tablet. None have worked.So now i am asking YOU,other owners and users how to load EBooks.Please don't tell me to use CALIBRE,have already used calibre,I used it to mamage the device and loaded books from Calibre straight to the tablet. Still could not open the EBooks.I can move books to the tablet, just cannot OPEN the books. Any HELP would be greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Acer Iconia Tab A700-10K32u
Reviews.Author: Joseph E Fontenot
Reviews.Content: we had bad  luck, received a700 in org. box, took out fiollowed inst. when we had answered questions, iconia tab wentt out, put back on and a pad lock appeared and that was the end of getting it to work, contacted Acer Tech. they advised to sent back to them to repair. contacted Amazon and they were very nice. and offered to ship a new Tab or refund, we went with refund.

Reviews.Title: Something is very wrong with this tablet
Reviews.Author: Babbak
Reviews.Content: I bought the A700 after being pleased with my older A200. I'm still pleased with the A200, not so much with the A700.On paper, it's a good tablet, but after owning it for 6 months, it is now being shipped back to be serviced.The list of issues and malfunctions:- Charger/OTG port is located at the bottom. If you want to connect an external HDD with an OTG cable, most tablet cases will have you lay on the OTG port.- Charger head is sensitive, and easily breaks. It broke.- Buying an original replacement was ridiculously expensive. I eventually found an original replacement on ebay. The non-original chargers were hard to come by as well, but at some point I found some.- The tablet stopped charging at some point. it started by not charging until it got drained and "rested" for a couple of days, but eventually stopped charging altogether (with an Acer charger)- The gravity sensor stopped working. Not sure if it was a HW or SW problem, because it was around the same time it stopped charging.- The screen had a strange smudge (internal), which never went away after it appeared.The A200 never had any such issues, and is till a great tablet (just a little weak in current standards). My next tablet is Asus TF300t (with the keyboard/battery extender).

Reviews.Title: Horrible tablet!
Reviews.Author: michael w irving
Reviews.Content: Long story short.  This was a gift gone completely wrong after a  short weeks time.  Display went out with in 30 days. Still worked on when connected through HDMI but a completely blank screen.  Sent it in for repair and received it back with a notation no problem found.  Sent it right back out the very next day back to the repair shop, they replaced the hard drive,  and got it back and not even 30 days later the exact same problem.  Sad to say, my tablet has spent more time in repair than in my own hands.  Now I'm waiting for a brand new one.  If this problem persist.  I just want a refund.  Acer Customer service was mostly helpful, except for 1 jerk I chatted with and couldve snatched him through my computer screen.  I would not recommend this tablet to anyone! Period!  This was supposed to ease me into the android system...guess I'll be sticking with apple :-/

Reviews.Title: not for me
Reviews.Author: jewell's toy
Reviews.Content: I didn't like it and sent it back, it looked like a refurbished tablet and I don't pay for anything with someone elses information in it

Reviews.Title: Good Value for Money!!
Reviews.Author: Shyam Garg
Reviews.Content: Pros: Things I likedIt is a nice good resolution screen Tablet in this price range.Good quad core processor.Screen brightness is decent.Inbuilt Mobile Dolby speaker is good.Battery life is Good.Cons: Things could have been better..There is No SWIPE soft keyboard option, I could not find a DOCK with keyboard from ACER.Graphics is not as responsive as I expected.Screen is reflective but bearable, lots of finger marks visible on screen after a slight usage also.Back panel would have been with better Grip.Camera 5Meg could have been better as compared to ASUS 8MP.Software update to newer versions are not as quick as other Top Android Tabs like NEXUS. Don't know when will it get 4.2 or upcoming versions updates??Android Add on Apps are not very useful, Overall feel of UI is not as good as Samsung or Nexus Android UI.I am overall happy and satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Eddie Maycen
Reviews.Content: good transaction. Fast and on time with the goods.  These are pretty easy to get but the price was right.  Will not let yoou move things to SD and it is hard to root

Reviews.Title: Love this Acer Tablet
Reviews.Author: face51
Reviews.Content: Great tablet. Display so sharp that ipad users are impressed. Have had this for 3 months without any problems whatsoever. Happy as can be with the product and fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet, great value
Reviews.Author: Dave Robinson
Reviews.Content: I should preface this review by stating that I paid $349 for this tablet, not the current price of $369 at this writing or the MSRP of $449, and my review does reflect that.I bought this tablet because I was specifically looking for a 10.1" class Android tablet with an HD screen for the specific purpose of reading comic books and secondarily for reading ebooks and browsing the web.As a comic book reader it is excellent. The screen is large, the books are clear. Unlike on my 7" 1024x600 tablet, I do not have to take my glasses off and hold the screen very close (I'm 49 with poor vision) to read the word balloons. I also like the 16:10 aspect ratio, as it is quite close to a comics page; it's a better ratio than an iPad for a single page, not quite as good for a two-page spread.It's also a great ebook reader, with clear text and full access to all the available ebook stores save one.I also agree with those who say that this tablet was made for Android 4.1, Jelly Bean, not the 4.0 it ships with. Jelly Bean both increases performance and reduces heat.Now for the cons:I'm on my second tablet already. My initial order locked up on the fourth update and the touch screen stopped responding. I did not install that update on the current tablet and have no intentions to do so at present.I dislike the charger port placement. I understand the need for the high-output proprietary connector with miro-USB compatibility, but the placement is poor, particularly if you are using the tablet in a folio-style case. My SO has an A100, and the power connector is on the end in one corner, which is a much more practical location.It's a great fit for my needs, and only the nagging question about that one update the placement of the USB connector detract enough from giving it a perfect score.There are better-performing tablets out there, but the overall feature set makes it a great choice for anyone looking for an HD reading tablet, particularly as long as it stays under $400.I had originally planned to buy a Fire HD 8.9" - but when I found I could get this plus a case for about the same price as a 16GB Fire HD with charger and case, the bigger screen and doubled storage won me over.I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: my acer is great this was my third tablet and by far the best I just wish i could have gotten the next level

Reviews.Title: its a start!!!......????? ...on hd tablets
Reviews.Author: tech savvy
Reviews.Content: Hard to tell yet since there are only a couple of HD tablets. Acer and Asus ..it a little too early to say if HD screens are really the way to go in a tablet..i agree with a lot of other reviews that both the brands mentioned there is a big performance issue due to the extra pixles...screen response  and other querks,, like first generation apps not working  even crashing the device..not enough development of HD apps,, heat issues .  Acer and Asus really need to focus on all those bugs and encorporate them into jelly bean os going through each tablet with  a fine tooth comb working out the kinks. Making each one make use of the quad core and nvidia 12 core gpuI personally think that even though Asus has a much better screen Than Acer ....I think Acer will prevail in The long run  buy the way Acer.. for the price of the a700.  Don't be cheap in the accessory side included in with your tablets... no USB dongles?????? Choose wisely ...... for to me it a matter of taste on which one you go with I think they will both prevail in the long run

Reviews.Title: Horrible Product - Returned to Amazon within 10 days
Reviews.Author: CD
Reviews.Content: I previously owned an Acer A500 which functioned well but the font quality bothered me during reading.  This tablet had a beautiful screen quality but otherwise was horrible.  Even when charging, the whole bottom portion of the tablet front and back heated up to the point of being concerning.  When using more than an hour, the tablet got hot with light to moderate web surfing and reading and eventually would slow down and then freeze and require a restart or a cooling down period.  The only time the tablet seemed to remain cool was in its sleep mode.  This is definitely a poor product and Acer did not show good judgment in releasing a tablet which basically requires a cooling fan.  It really deserves less than one star.  By the way, I also own a Google Nexus 7 which produces no heat whatsoever with use and I tried a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10" which produced mild heat but had slow web page loading.  I'm not over- blowing the amount of heat produced by this tablet (in fact I was able to feel the warmth through a leather cover that I had leftover from my previous Acer A500).  Just my opinion, but I think it's dangerous to have a tablet that generates screen-side and back-side heat for the entire bottom half of the tablet when reading a web article or watching half a movie.  I'd recommend that most people who want longevity in their electronics pass this one over in spite of the beautiful screen.Also Android 4.1 Jelly Bean supposedly has been released for the Acer A700; however, during the time I had it, it did not automatically update to Jelly Bean, so the tablet I had only ran on Ice Sandwich, so I have no idea of how Jelly Bean would have affected this product's performance.

Reviews.Title: Acer A700 to hot to handle
Reviews.Author: Milton A. Parker "doctorpee"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this Acer A700 and received it in about a week. Was very excited about a new tablet with new technology. Set-up was a breeze and the tablet seem well built. But, regrettably, looks are very deceiving.This tablet is as bad as some of the of the negative reviews mention. First, it gets incredibly hot and is uncomfortable to hold. In the first few hours of operation I was kicked off the Internet connection a few times. Later, when I placed the tablet in a custom case it apparently over heated to the point that it completely shut down had to reboot to use it again. After 2 days of seer frustration I requested a return to Amazon. If you are considering the Acer A700 it may be better to look at tablets with better performance and reliability track records.

Reviews.Title: Great Tab
Reviews.Author: Gloria V. Curry
Reviews.Content: This was an early christmas present for a freind and she absolutley adores her tablet. It arrived in perfect condition with all accessories listed in the purchase information.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on tablets and decided on the Acer A700, For my purpose it does more then the Ipad. It's a great first tablet for the price. I will never go back to the Ipad. This one does have a heat problem but not so bad that it interferes with the use of it. Video is fantastic, the ability to add sd flash memory is a plus. Will buy Acer again.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I love it! It does everything I expected and more. The hd screen is amazing. I strongly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Another Good buy
Reviews.Author: John E. Meyer "Old School"
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st tablet.  I use it pretty much as though I would my smart phone and computer to access the net for needed info.

Reviews.Title: Acer HD tab
Reviews.Author: drevans009
Reviews.Content: Nice looking tablet. Great size. Beautiful picture quality. Only thing I have noticed, the tablet needs to be reset about once or twice a day. Does get a little warm with extended use.

Reviews.Title: Heavy and got too hot to hold
Reviews.Author: coolhikers
Reviews.Content: Heavy item and got hot to hold returned item I would hope ACER could have fixed it, The reviews of this were right it gets hol

Reviews.Title: Acer
Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: I can't give any of those technical reviews where the person tells you dpis per square inch of pixels or whatever. I tend to think of Acer as the poor man's computer. I've been buying Acer products for what feels like a decade. They are always good. I love this tablet. It is a great tablet for cheap. I've never had a problem with a single Acer product ever.

Reviews.Title: good but not as expected
Reviews.Author: fagr
Reviews.Content: there is no coparison between the A700 and the asus infinity although they have almost the same specification but the asus infinity is a way better than the a700 .

Reviews.Title: Acer a700
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful screen, heavy and gets quite hot. Im returning mine for the Asus tf700 and hopefully the Asus will be the ticket.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service
Reviews.Author: SONYA
Reviews.Content: The low rating is not for the tab itself, but rather for the seller.Within one week of getting this product, the charger chord tore, barely hanging on by the wires, which are more or less still intact.I immediately contacted the seller and stated my problem, and 5 months later, still no response or action on their part.I have to actually move the chord around several times to get it to charge the tablet fully.I hope that after typing this review something may actually be done.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: Got this tablet 06/23.  It replaces the A500 which was very good.  The a700 feels very light in hand and has a good solid feel.  I will give a updated review as I use it more.UPDATE:This tablet was getting kind of hot like others have stated.  Sent it in to Acer service and got it back and it no longer gets hot.  Don't know what they did, but it worked, no more heat issue.  This is a very solid tablet with a beautiful HD display.  Photos I have taken with it look great.

Reviews.Title: Meets expectations
Reviews.Author: Vadim Kochedykov
Reviews.Content: The wonderful thing that is worth the money. A lot of useful applications already built, unfortunately some of them do not work in Russia, as suggest specific services that are not provided in the Russian Federation. The screen is very responsive (sorry, got a bit after rebate stickers matte protective film). One drawback - a very long time charging, probably 4 hours, if not more. All in all, a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Charger died in 3 months
Reviews.Author: Anwar Hasan
Reviews.Content: I bought an Acer a700 10 inch tablet six months ago. Three months later the charger died. Still cannot find a new charger. It was a big mistake buying an Acer. Will go for Samsung next time. Very durable and parts available everywhere.

Reviews.Title: after market keyboard issues
Reviews.Author: Little Dude
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer Iconia W3 from a friend who tests products.  I purchased an after market keyboard/case and stand kit from Amazon;  I couldn't get the table to recognize the keyboard because I couldn't find how to turn on the Bluetooth on the tablet.  Once I found the "change PC Settings" at the bottom of the settings icon I was able to get the click on the "Devices" tab and it recognized my keyboard.  I then tried to type and wasn't able to get it to type until I typed a few letters on the touchscreen keyboard and then started typing on the bluetooth keyboard and it worked great from then on.  The Acer Manual is useless as it doesn't even discuss where to access bluetooth.  Won't these geeks ever write a decent manual  I enjoy using the Acer now that I have figured out the little things that make it work, no thanks to the people that make the Device.

Reviews.Title: Problem!!!!

Reviews.Content: Upon receipt of the tablet, such as no problems were found, but later found out that one speaker does not work, although both have to work. After some time, burned food blog, in general I can not even put what ever appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: Notebook
Reviews.Author: jcopland
Reviews.Content: Haven't really had a chance to use it yet, but I think it will work great.  Got it for use on long vacation to hook up with a  Jetpack to pay bills.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: A Fan
Reviews.Content: Ordered A700 to replace Acer A500 that is ~ one year old and has provided good service. The A700 arrived yesterday - and it's great. Many significant improvements. This Acer gets my approval.

Reviews.Title: Awesome !

Reviews.Content: Pros: Love it, really Fast and Killer Screen ..  Games and Video are Unreal ..Cons: Gets a little too hotStill worth it , get it

Reviews.Content: i was so looking forward to using this for businesss and books....its less than 6 months later and today it would not reboot...my husband who is a computer geek tried everything from everywhere and finally reset it and we found out its a hardware problem, and the warranty is only 30 days..so 500;00 later and no tablet to use.......we are sticking to laptops from here on in!!!ASUS TF700T-B1-GR 10.1-Inch Tablet (Gray)
